sentence.Network_en: They rose to the challenge of entertaining 80 school-children for an afternoon.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们一个下午成功接待了80名学童。

sentence.Network_en: It was a marvellous afternoon with a huge turnout of people.
sentence.Network_cn: 那是个美妙的下午，出席人数众多。

sentence.Network_en: The President met this afternoon with his top military advisers.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统今天下午会见了他最得力的军事顾问。

entry.def: The afternoon is the part of each day which begins at lunchtime and ends at about six o'clock.

example.ex: He had stayed in his room all afternoon.
example.tran: 他整个下午都呆在房间里。

means.word_mean: 1. the part of the day between noon and evening;

sentences.sentence: "he spent a quiet afternoon in the park"

means.word_mean: 2. a conventional expression of greeting or farewell

auth_sentence.content: Wonder what they've got planned for this afternoon?
auth_sentence.res_content: Wonder what they've got planned for this afternoon?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Wonder what they've got planned for this afternoon?

auth_sentence.content: It helps to enliven a dull afternoon of cricket.
auth_sentence.res_content: It helps to enliven a dull afternoon of cricket.

auth_sentence.content: I went back to drinking coffee in the afternoon.

Sentence.sentence: She's afraid she won't be able to attend your class this afternoon though.
I'm afraid I can't come any earlier because I have three classes this afternoon
Didn't I see you going into the administration building this afternoon?
The cheque came in yesterday afternoon.
Oh, Julie invited her friends over in the afternoon and they ate it all.

means.word_mean: 下午（中午 12 点至 6 点左右）

sentences.en: We have no class this afternoon.

jushi.english: One afternoon last week he went out with Arthur to the University of California.
jushi.chinese: 上周的一天下午他和亚瑟去了加利福尼亚大学。

jushi.english: Late in the afternoon of a chilly day she was born in a little fishing village.
jushi.chinese: 在一个寒冷的傍晚,她出生在一个小小的渔村。

jushi.english: On a hot afternoon I called on Mr. Green.
jushi.chinese: 在一个炎热的下午,我拜访了格林先生。
